snippet: A police officer who killed an unarmed 18-year-old in the bathroom of his apartment was stripped of his gun and badge, said Raymond W. Kelly, the police commissioner.
abstract: New York City Police Commissioner Raymond W Kelly, in rare early assessment of a shooting, expresses concern over the killing of unarmed teenager Ramarley Graham in the bathroom of Graham's Bronx apartment by a plainclothes police officer; Kelly, stopping short of calling the shooting unjustified, says that an investigation of the officer's actions is underway, and that he has been placed on modified duty.

byline.original: By AL BAKER and JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN

lead_paragraph: A police officer who killed an unarmed 18-year-old in the bathroom of his apartment was stripped of his gun and badge, said Raymond W. Kelly, the police commissioner.

headline.seo: Raymond Kelly Voices Concern on Fatal Police Shooting in Bronx
headline.main: Kelly Expresses Concern Over Fatal Shooting in Bronx
headline.print_headline: Commissioner Voices Concern On Fatal Shooting Of Unarmed Man
